page.title: 01Rogate
page.content: We have been surveying the village area of Rogate which is on the borders of Hampshire and Sussex. It got its name from the gates which used to surround the village to keep out the Roe deer, still plentiful in the area. The main body of the village is clustered around the cross roads, East West, Petersfield to Midhurst, an old coach road and North South, Hillbrow to Harting, very close to a smugglers route. All the main features of the village are here the church, the school, the shop,the village hall and two large public houses. Athough Petersfield, Midhurst and Chichester are within a radius of fifteen miles it is a very thriving active community with various organisations to serve the people such as Women's Institute, Brownies and several sports clubs.
